result.execSummary:
Christopher J. Goyer was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Christopher J. Goyer was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J. Goyer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant's & JCJ Notice of Hearing for the 11/18/14 Review Hearing
-Returned by BY JCSD with notation NOT HERE
Bond and Defendant's Scheduling Notice returned by JCSD
Review hearing on November 18, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Case called at 10:41 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Christopher J. Goyer in court, in custody, with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Rhiel confirms Mr. Goyer would like to waive extradition
Court has colloquy with Mr. Goyer re: rights/waiver of extradition
Mr. Goyer endorses waiver of extradition & Atty Rhiel submits to the Court; Court endorses
Court informs parties that it will schedule Review Hearing in 30 days to be sure transport has taken place

NEXT: Schedule Review Hearing in 30 days to be sure transport has taken place

Case called at 1:26 pm
Defendant Christopher J. Goyer in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews conflict review, court finds no reason to recuse or disqualify itself.
Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and is satisfied that it sets forth a reason that the court could order a commitment
Court review statue and Court concludes that the person in front of the Court is the person charged in the extradition complaint.
Court commits defendant to the County Jail for a period of time not to exceed 30 days
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $10,000.00 CASH bond, with no special conditions.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient.

Recess: 1:35 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Hearing on return of commitment: 10/29/14 at 1:15 pm
